snippet: School officials have refused a $5,000 award given by the Playboy Foundation to a local high school newspaper. But the newspaper's faculty adviser said she planned to accept the award.    In a letter on Thursday, two San Francisco Unified School D...
lead_paragraph: School officials have refused a $5,000 award given by the Playboy Foundation to a local high school newspaper. But the newspaper's faculty adviser said she planned to accept the award. In a letter on Thursday, two San Francisco Unified School District associate superintendents thanked the foundation for recognizing the quality of the newspaper, The West Wing, which is produced by students at Mission High School. The letter said taking money associated with Playboy did not mesh with the school district's mission.
abstract: School officials in San Francisco district refuse $5,000 award from Playboy Foundation to local high school newspaper; say taking money from Playboy does not mesh with district's mission (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; High School Refuses $5,000 Playboy Award
